name: github_scenario_add_rest_endpoints_for_product_entity_with_get_pos
description: Test case for: As a user, I want to add REST endpoints for Product entity with GET, POST, PUT, DELETE operations.

parts.text: add REST endpoints for Product entity with GET, POST, PUT, DELETE operations.

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I can add REST endpoints for a Product entity (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE). Before I create files and branches, we need to configure the repository so changes are tracked and pushed from the start. Since you're adding a REST API, this will influence language and template choices (Python vs Java) and whether we create a new branch or use an existing one.

Please choose how you'd like to set up the repository:

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]
